title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI), showcasing a modern development board application. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and explores best practices in TypeScript-based React development. The project aims to provide a practical example and learning resource for building complex web applications with these technologies.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository houses a web-based interface built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, designed to visualize and interact with data from a robotic fleet. This project focuses on creating a user-friendly dashboard that allows for monitoring, control, and analysis of robot activities and performance, effectively serving as a central hub for managing and understanding a deployed robotic system.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: crud-expense-tracker is a simple, responsive web application built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML for managing personal expenses. It utilizes Material-UI for a clean and intuitive user interface and provides full CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) functionality for adding, viewing, editing, and removing expense entries. This project serves as a practical example of implementing basic CRUD operations within a front-end application.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python and Flask, leveraging PostgreSQL for database management and styled with HTML and CSS. This project showcases the implementation of core web development principles, demonstrating a practical example of creating, reading, updating, and deleting data through a user-friendly interface, managed by a Flask-based backend and deployed via shell scripting. The repository serves as a learning resource for those interested in building web applications with Python, PostgreSQL, and common front-end technologies.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository showcases a project focused on map visualization, leveraging HTML for the front-end interface and Python for backend processing and data handling. It provides a dynamic and interactive way to display geographical data, allowing users to explore and analyze information presented on a map. The project demonstrates practical application of web development principles and data visualization techniques.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project exploring modern web development techniques using TypeScript and JavaScript. This repository serves as a personal project space for experimentation and building applications, focusing on practical implementation and exploration of various project structures and approaches to web development.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern, responsive dashboard project built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, providing a scalable and maintainable foundation for web applications. It showcases best practices for structuring a Next.js application and includes features for data visualization, user management, and a customizable UI, making it a useful template and learning resource for developers interested in building dashboard interfaces.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a collaborative project idea board built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to facilitate brainstorming and organization of project concepts. It offers a clean and intuitive interface for users to easily add, view, and manage project ideas, making it a useful tool for teams or individuals looking to kickstart their next project.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using a combination of TeX for the document structure and content, and HTML for potential web-based presentation. It serves as a personal project demonstrating skills in document creation and potentially web development, focused on showcasing my professional experience and qualifications.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a web-based application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep hours and track the accumulated sleep deficit over time, providing insights into their sleep patterns and promoting healthier sleep habits. It serves as a practical example of using TypeScript in a front-end project and demonstrates effective web development techniques.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebooks and Python, provides hands-on projects and practical examples for exploring financial concepts. It covers a range of topics within finance, offering users a practical approach to learning and applying Python for financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern, full-stack IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Supabase, leveraging Tailwind CSS for a responsive and visually appealing user interface. The project demonstrates real-time location monitoring and management of assets, showcasing best practices in TypeScript development and Supabase integration within a Next.js environment.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-Event-Calendar is a JavaScript, CSS, and HTML-based project providing a customizable and interactive event calendar solution. This project allows users to easily create, manage, and display events dynamically on a web page, offering flexibility in styling and integration for various applications. It focuses on delivering a simple yet functional calendar experience with a clean and responsive design.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js (TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS) for creating and participating in secure and transparent polls. This project leverages modern web technologies to provide a user-friendly voting experience, focusing on simplicity and ease of use for both poll creators and voters. It is a practical demonstration of building a dynamic web application and explores core concepts related to web development.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project built with TypeScript, leveraging Express.js for the backend, Vite.js for the frontend, and the Gemini API to create interactive and engaging conversational experiences. The application utilizes HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for a dynamic user interface and explores the integration of AI-powered dialogue within a modern web environment.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project provides a user-friendly interface to easily filter, search, and interpret ROS logs, aiding in debugging and understanding the behavior of ROS-based systems. It allows users to efficiently pinpoint issues and gain insights into their robotic applications through intuitive log analysis.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a project showcasing interactive world map functionality built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository explores the implementation of dynamic map elements and interactions, providing a learning resource and potential foundation for web applications requiring geographical data visualization and user engagement.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a comprehensive e-commerce platform built using Next.js 14 (Pages Router), TypeScript, and React. This project showcases a modern and performant online shopping experience, leveraging Material UI (MUI) for a clean and responsive design and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. The repository serves as a practical example for developers looking to build similar e-commerce applications with a focus on type safety and best practices.
